page.title: 02FARMING IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: The{Manor Farm}is in Upper Chedworth situated near the Church with many of the farm buildings clustered near. It has many acres of arable land surrounding part of the old aerodrome which includes{Newport {Farm}and some woodland.They have one large herd of Friesian cows. {Hartpury Farm}in Middle Chedworth own the only herd of Jersey cows in the district.They only have a small acreage so therefore rent the valley fields for grazing and hay.Their cows walk through the village still - on the way to milking. Two farmers in the area of{Pinkwell own grazing land that maintains flocks of several varieties of sheep including a rare{Manx}breed.Within the boundaries of the village lies part of a 7,000 acre estate.{Raebrook Farm}has a large herd of beef cattle - mainly
